word.name: Abdomen
word.hint: The region between the pelvis and the thorax.

word.name: Cell Membrane
word.hint: The double layer of lipids and proteins that surrounds a cell and separates the cytoplasm.

word.name: Photosynthesis
word.hint: A process used by plants and other organisms to convert light energy into chemical energy

word.name: Charles Darwin
word.hint: The naturalist who created the theory of evolution.

word.name: Gregor Mendel
word.hint: An Austrian monk who discovered the basic principles of genetic inheritance.

word.name: Binocular Vision
word.hint: An animal who's eyes are projected forward, to which the field of view overlap, enabling the creature to judge depth.

word.name: Fungus
word.hint: Eukaryotic heterotrophic organisms that live as saprophytes or parasites.

word.name: Host
word.hint: An organism that can harbor or nourish another organism.

word.name: Lysis
word.hint: The rupture and destruction of a cell, resulting in loss of cellular contents.

word.name: Pathogen
word.hint: An organism that is capable of causing an infection, or harming a host cell.

word.name: Equilibrium
word.hint: When a reaction reaches a position where it has no tendency to change.

word.name: Burette
word.hint: A graduated glass tube with a tap at one end, for delivering known volumes of a liquid, especially in titrations.

word.name: Bulb-pipette
word.hint: A volumetric piece of equipment which allows extremely accurate measurement of volume of a solution.

word.name: Marie Curie
word.hint: The famous chemist who discovered Radium and Polonium.

word.name: Alfred Nobel
word.hint: The famous chemist who invented the explosive Dynamite.

word.name: Bond Angle
word.hint: The angle formed between two adjacent chemical bonds within the same atom.

word.name: Oxygen
word.hint: A colourless, odourless reactive gas, which we breathe and is found in air.

word.name: Le Chatelier
word.hint: A principle stating that if a constraint is applied to a system in equilibrium, equilibrium will shift to counteract the effect.

word.name: Mole Ratio
word.hint: A ratio or fraction comparing the numbers of moles of any two components involved in a chemical reaction.

word.name: Reactant
word.hint: The starting material for a chemical reaction.

word.name: Product
word.hint: The substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction.

word.name: Acceleration
word.hint: The rate of change of an object with respect to time.

word.name: Albert Einstein
word.hint: German-born theoretical physicist.

word.name: Big Bang
word.hint: The huge "explosion" 13.7 billion years ago.

word.name: Cosmic Rays
word.hint: High speed, energetic particles in which are generated by our sun.

word.name: Black Hole
word.hint: A region of empty space.

word.name: Dark Matter
word.hint: Matter that gives out no light and does not interact with the electromagnetic force.

word.name: Stephen Hawking
word.hint: A famous, well-known, theoretical physicist.

word.name: Gravity
word.hint: The natural phenomenon by which all things with mass are brought toward one another.

word.name: Inertia
word.hint: The resistance of any physical object to any change in its position and state of motion.

word.name: Universe
word.hint: Everything that physically exists, including the entirety of space and time, all forms of matter, energy and momentum, and the physical laws and constants that govern them.
